messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Being less structured
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 7/4/00 9:11:18 AM Central Daylight Time, NumoAstro@aol.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/4/00 9:11:18 AM Central Daylight Time, NumoAstro@...
writes:

<< I think that sometimes I still have a hard time going from being the woman
that was very organized in the working world and having to schedule
everything to just letting things happen now that I have 2 kids.

>>
This is me, too. I have been home now for 5 yrs, but it is still difficult
at times to be less structured, and to just "go with the flow". I think it's
partly a personality thing, too-- I am who I am. :) But, with my dh being
very laid back, it's probably not so bad that I am more the
organizer/scheduler type! (We balance each other out.) I am getting better
at being more of a facilitator when it comes to my kids, as opposed to being
the teacher. It has not been easy after having taught school for 10yrs. I
have had to "de-school", and unlearn some things-- and it's been tough at
times! ~Karen
